# selectedOverlay

**Instance Property**

The selected overlay on the map.

## Declaration

```swift
get selectedOverlay(): Overlay | null;
set selectedOverlay(overlay: Overlay | null);
```

## Discussion

To deselect any selected overlay, set this property to `null`.

To select an overlay that’s already part of the map, set this property to the desired overlay.

When MapKit JS removes the selected overlay from the map (as an effect of [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Map/removeOverlay], [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Map/removeOverlays], or setting a new set of overlays with the [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Map/overlays] property), MapKit JS deselects the overlay before removing it.

## Adding and removing overlays

- **overlays**: An array of all of the map’s overlays.
- **overlaysAtPoint(point)**: Returns an array of overlays at a given point on the webpage.
- **addOverlay(overlay)**: Adds an overlay to the map.
- **addOverlays(overlays)**: Adds multiple overlays to the map.
- **removeOverlay(overlay)**: Removes an overlay from the map.
- **removeOverlays(overlays)**: Removes multiple overlays from the map.
- **topOverlayAtPoint(point)**: Returns the topmost overlay at a given point on the webpage.
